selected_quotes: Love this vision for the #RioGrande borderlands. We need more this vision and less division. #nowall #rethinkrivers
FDR wanted to create a US-Mexico international peace park in the 1930s #noborderwall
.@Gabphox Building a wall on a wide, inhabited river corridor w/flood risks is a dubious goal
Here's a better vision for the US-Mexico border: build an international park
Instead of building a wall, imagine spending $billions to green the #USMexicoborder;

citation.abstract: Instead of building a wall on the US-Mexico border, a landscape architect calls for restoring the Rio Grande and turning its course into an international park – an idea first proposed in the 1930s.
citation.title: Here's a better vision for the US-Mexico border: Make  the Rio Grande grand again

facebook.title: Here's a better vision for the US-Mexico border: Make the Rio Grande grand again
facebook.summary: Build an international park instead of a wall, and there would be benefits on both side of the border in the environment, agriculture, flood control, tourism, and human relations.

facebook.title: Here's a better vision for the US-Mexico border: Make the Rio Grande grand again
facebook.summary: Instead of building a wall on the US-Mexico border, a landscape architect calls for restoring the Rio Grande and turning its course into an international park – an idea first proposed in the 1930s.

author.name: Nae-Nee - Dystopian Series on Human Overpopulation and Ecosystems Collapse
author.facebook_wall_name: Nae-Nee - Dystopian Series on Human Overpopulation and Ecosystems Collapse

facebook.title: Here's a better vision for the US-Mexico border: Make the Rio Grande grand again
facebook.summary: "Rather than spending billions of dollars on a border wall, here is an alternative vision: regenerating the Rio Grande, which forms more than half of the border, to form the core of a binational park that showcases our spectacular shared landscape."

facebook.title: Here's a better vision for the US-Mexico border: Make the Rio Grande grand again
facebook.summary: Reviving the Rio Grande as an international park instead of building a wall on the US-Mexico border would have benefits for the environment, agriculture, flood control - and people.
